sentence.Network_en: From this it was but a step to beggary.
sentence.Network_cn: 这只差一步就沦为乞丐了.

sentence.Network_en: There's beggary in the love that can be reckoned.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以量深浅的爱是贫乏的.

sentence.Network_en: In those years the landless peasants were brought to beggary.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那些年月里无地的农民一贫如洗.

list.abs: 6. Idleness is the key of beggary.  懒惰出乞丐;人懒必穷.  来自互联网  7. His speculation reduced him to beggary.  他的投机使他陷于赤贫.  来自.

means.word_mean: 1. a solicitation for money or food (especially in the street by an apparently penniless person)
2. a state of extreme poverty or destitution;

sentences.sentence: "a general state of need exists among the homeless"
